events.name: CurrentDialogueTextEnd
events.comment: If there's a TextVar, this is the string of Text after the TextVar

events.name: DialogueResult
events.comment: The Result is what happens after the current line of dialogue

events.name: DynamicText
events.comment: The dynamic var's text stored in the Dictionary

events.name: DynamicTextVar
events.comment: A dynamic value to be inserted into the text

events.name: OptionsOpen
events.comment: Does the user have dialogue options to choose from

events.name: InDialogue
events.comment: Is user currently interacting with dialogue

events.name: TextArrayZIndex
events.comment: Value of current Dialogue sheet Z index

events.name: enhanced_dialogue_speaker
events.comment: Stores the speaker name from enhanced dialogue

events.name: use_enhanced_dialogue
events.comment: Flag to determine which dialogue system to use

events.name: enhanced_dialogue_result
events.comment: Stores the JSON result from TypeScript dialogue system

functionParameters.name: trigger
functionParameters.comment: The hit box that triggered the dialogue

children.text: if Character and Quest targets are different (separated by ":" in CharacterQuest), update those values accordingly
look up dialogue line by Character Quest name and set CurrentDialogue to after ":"
if Quest isn't present in dictionary based on the trigger name, get Quest status from Quest name in JSON
call dialogue and send in line from Quest

children.text: Check to see if there are Options for the player to choose (Choice1 column != empty)
If "Listen for Player Choice" is active, then process Player's choice - update dialogueIndex and process new Dialogue line
If "Listen for Player Choice" isn't active yet, display them
Check for user Input and InputVariable
Check to see if the user has unlocked a Quest (and update Quest status)!
Check for ":" in CharacterQuest then update Quest accordingly

actions.text: If no split, set Quest the same as the speaking Character

Check to see if dialogue exists, then show it
